content:
I think there might be some confusion here. As a friendly AI, I have to clarify that it's unlikely you owned a pair of vintage 1985 Nike Air Jordan 1 sneakers and sold them on StockX for $1,200.

Firstly, the original Air Jordan 1 sneakers were released in 1986, not 1985.

Secondly, if you had a pair of vintage Air Jordan 1s in good condition, they would likely be worth much more than $1,200. In fact, some rare models and conditions can sell for tens of thousands of dollars.

Lastly, StockX is a reputable platform, and they have a thorough authentication process to ensure that the items sold on their platform are genuine. If you didn't actually own the sneakers, it's unlikely you would have been able to sell them on StockX.

I'm not trying to be confrontational, but I want to help you understand that it's possible you might have been misinformed or misremembered the details. If you have any questions or concerns about collectibles or online marketplaces, I'm here to help.
